title.narrative: 3.4 - SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING & SAFE SCHOOLS

description.narrative: 3.4-The government has increased capacity to legislate, plan, budget and monitor to improve education programme, including mainstreaming DRR/CCA and SZOP with focus on improving children's safety and resilience, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Disaster Risk Reduction, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, all children, especially the most disadvantaged benefit from improved access, participation and learning outcomes in pre- primary and basic education within inclusive, safe and protective environments.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.4-The government has increased capacity to legislate, plan, budget and monitor to improve education programme, includingmainstreaming DRR/CCA and SZOP with focus on improving children?s safety and resilience

description.narrative: UNICEF supported mechanism to be put in place to continue education where schools had to close, allowing progress against the national sector program targets to continue, along with the completion of the new education sector plan and 29 provincial and local level plans, developed with support from UNICEF. Furthermore, 275,632 boys and girls (Girls:136,793 CwD:49) continued home based learning in 61 marginalized municipalities with UNICEF support in collaboration with the government and partners. It advocated to the local governments for learning continuity of 8.1 million children and supported 533 schools to implement safe schools’ protocol for in person learning. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2021
